text: [Music]
my name is laa tardy and I'm a professor
both in the genetics and the radiation
oncology departments at the Stanford
school of medicine I grew up in Southern
California because my father was a
professor at Caltech so I'm a little bit
of an unusual case because my two
parents and step parents were all
biologists I then went to Cornell
University for my undergraduate in bioch
CH istry did my PhD at University of
California at Berkeley with Robert tan
and then went to MIT where I decided I
wanted to study Mouse models of cancer
with Tyler Jax and after my postto there
I came out to Stanford for my faculty
position I really appreciate the value
of using a genetic model system and I um
have been very committed to studying
cancer in the mouse and to study this
p-53 tumor suppressor in that setting
and so we we try to do experiments that
will give mechanistic insight into how
p-53 works it's a transcription Factor
it activates many Target genes and we're
working to deconstruct the Target genes
that are involved in its tumor
suppressor function I think it's uh just
incredibly satisfying and exciting to to
learn more about how things work in
biology and and to do so in the context
of a disease that really it needs lots
of attention it's uh solving the cancer
problem is a big one and I am just
thrilled to be part of the the effort
that is trying to understand how it
develops and what we can do about it by
gaining that understanding
[Music]
